name: T-Bar Row
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a T-bar handle with both hands, keeping your elbows slightly bent and your arms at shoulder height.
2. Engage your core and maintain a straight back throughout the exercise.
3. Keeping your upper body stable, lift the bar away from you by hinging at your hips and squeezing your lats.
4. Focus on using your back and arm muscles to pull the T-bar towards your chest.
5. Lower the bar back down to the starting position, trying not to swing or jerk it.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: T-Bar Rows are an upper body exercise that primarily targets the latissimus dorsi and other back muscles.
